body:
Thanks for the issue, we will take it into consideration! Our team of engineers is busy working on many types of features, please give us time to get back to you.

To our amazing contributors: [issues labeled `bug`](https://github.com/forem/forem/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3Abug) are always up for grabs, but for feature requests, please wait until we add a `ready for dev` before starting to work on it.

If this is a feature request from an external contributor (not core team at Forem), please close the issue and re-post via [GitHub Discussions](https://github.com/forem/forem/discussions/categories/feature-requests).

To claim an issue to work on, please leave a comment. If you've claimed the issue and need help, please ping @forem-team. The OSS Community Manager or the engineers on OSS rotation will follow up.

For full info on how to contribute, please check out our [contributors guide](https://developers.forem.com/contributing-guide/forem).

performed_via_github_app.name: GitHub Actions
performed_via_github_app.description: Automate your workflow from idea to production

body: Good afternoon  @forem-team , @benhalpern   ! Iâ€™ve been working on this bug and I believe Iâ€™ve found a solution. The code from the latest version of this repository (without the bug fix) doesn't pass all the tests, at least on my machine. Any suggestions? Thank you in advance for your time and availability!

issue.title: Fix issue#21636

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
## What type of PR is this? (check all applicable)

- [ ] Refactor
- [ ] Feature
- [x] Bug Fix
- [ ] Optimization
- [ ] Documentation Update

## Description

This pull request resolves an issue in the Embed component, where YouTube videos failed to render correctly when the provided URL included query parameters such as ?si= or ?t=. The problem stemmed from the fact that only clean YouTube URLs â€” without any query strings â€” were successfully processed. This limitation affected the user experience, especially considering that most YouTube share links include such parameters by default. To address this, the logic within the YoutubeTag component has been improved to robustly extract the video ID and, when applicable, the start time, from a wide variety of YouTube URL formats. This includes standard YouTube links like https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VIDEO_ID, shortened links such as https://youtu.be/VIDEO_ID, and links containing additional parameters (for example, ?t=30s for start time markers or ?si=abc123 for share tokens). Support for time markers has been enhanced by parsing time values from the query string â€” for instance, ?t=300s â€” and applying them appropriately to the embed. The UnifiedEmbed registry has also been updated to recognize and classify these YouTube URLs reliably, regardless of format or the presence of additional query parameters.

Finally, the test suite has been expanded to include all supported URL variations, ensuring comprehensive coverage and reducing the risk of regressions in future updates. This update significantly improves the robustness, usability, and compatibility of the YouTube embedding feature across real-world usage scenarios.


## Related Tickets & Documents

- Related Issue #21636
- Closes #21636

## QA Instructions, Screenshots, Recordings

After logging into your Forem account and attempting to create a post using a YouTube embed component, you should verify that the changes have been applied correctly and the result is as expected.

The following link demonstrates the expected outcome of the implemented changes using various YouTube URLs.

https://youtu.be/mB5kialiMJQ

### UI accessibility checklist
_If your PR includes UI changes, please utilize this checklist:_
- [ ] Semantic HTML implemented?
- [ ] Keyboard operability supported?
- [ ] Checked with [axe DevTools](https://www.deque.com/axe/) and addressed `Critical` and `Serious` issues?
- [ ] Color contrast tested?

_For more info, check out the
[Forem Accessibility Docs](https://developers.forem.com/frontend/accessibility)._

## Added/updated tests?
_We encourage you to keep the code coverage percentage at 80% and above._

- [x] Yes
- [ ] No, and this is why: _please replace this line with details on why tests
      have not been included_
- [ ] I need help with writing tests

## [optional] Are there any post deployment tasks we need to perform?

## [optional] What gif best describes this PR or how it makes you feel?
